title: Collonges-la-Rouge
text:
Only registered TrekEarth members may write critiques. Photographer's Note 
"Collonges-la-Rouge is a commune in the department of Corr√®ze in Limousin -. France.Collonges-la-Rouge is completely built of red sandstone Its existence is proven since the eighth century thanks to the donation of Limoges Count the parish to the monastery of Charroux. The village is a member of the Les Plus Beaux Villages de France (Les Plus Beaux Villages de France) association, and is actually where this association was created. Its one of the most visited websites in the Limousin. " Wikipedia
